item.title: Best Motherboard for intel core i5-11600K Gaming PC
item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: Choosing the best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K doesn’t necessarily implies to buy any motherboard available on the market since it is essential to choose a motherboard that hits your gaming PC requirements just like other components, as it is one of the most complex parts of a computer. Finding the best Motherboard is a complex ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Choosing the best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K doesn’t necessarily implies to buy any motherboard available on the market since it is essential to choose a motherboard that hits your gaming PC requirements just like other components, as it is one of the most complex parts of a computer.

Finding the best Motherboard is a complex task that needs a lot of analysis to accomplish. The Motherboard for Core i5-11600K is undoubtedly the crucial element of this hardware puzzle, and it is the foundation of your configuration on which every element rests. It determines many criteria such as the format of your tower, the number and nature of connectors and functions, the type of processor used, and so on.

Indeed, choosing the best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K has traditionally received less attention than selecting the processor and graphics card. At the same time, almost every component of the PC is connected to the Motherboard. It is its form factor that directly affects the size of your PC, and the processor model that you can use depends on the chipset and socket. In our guide, you will definitely know about the best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K. 

What is Motherboard?

A motherboard is the basis for assembling all its components for computer because it is the main component of the central unit. It is an electronic card that allows all the printed circuits of the computer that interconnected with this. However, the best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K does not ensure the performance of your machine, but it allows all of your components to express their potential and capacity.

When choosing a motherboard, the principle of “more expensive the better result we get” does not work. A rich set of features, including overclocking functions for the processor and RAM, is unnecessary for everyone, which means there is no point in overpaying for them. At the same time, you shouldn’t give up on additional USB ports, HDMI, and connectors for connecting SATA or M.2 drives.

Intel Core i5 11600K

The Intel Core i5 11600K uses a new architecture and finally abandons the foundation that Skylake laid back in 2015. This foundation has been maintained for the last five years and has even been present in the Comet Lake-S series, which means that the IPC has remained static on Intel desktop processors until the arrival of Rocket Lake-S.

The Intel Core i5 11600K uses the Cypress Cove architecture, a 14nm adaptation of the Sunny Cove architecture, initially conceived for Ice Lake (10nm) processors. Thanks to this new architecture, Intel claims to improve the CPI by up to 19%. When we analyzed the Intel Core i9 11900K, we only fulfilled cases and very specific situations.

Intel Core i5 11600K Features:

  • Cypress Cove architecture in 14 nm +++ process.
  • 125-watt TDP (PL1).
  • Six cores and twelve threads at 3.9 GHz-4.9 GHz
  • GPU Intel UHD Graphics 750 (Xe Gen12).
  • Unlocked multiplier (supports overclocking).
  • 12MB L3 cache.

Best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K Elements:

The Motherboard is installed in the central unit of your gaming PC and is one of the essential elements of computer hardware. The most important concepts and elements are:

  • The chipset: a set of components linked to your card; it allows you to adjust the connections between your different components. 
  • BIOS: This is software integrated into the Motherboard, allowing you to start-up of your machine. You will be able to adjust many parameters, such as the boot sequence and frequencies.
  • Processor: You should know that any motherboard has its socket allowing the processor to connect with the Motherboard. 
  • High-end Wi-Fi and ports: The high-end Wi-Fi card and slots largely increase the price of motherboards. Therefore, we advise you to opt for this kind of Motherboard with these options only if it is essential for you.
  • The RAM slots: these are the slots for the RAM modules. For office automation or simple multimedia, 2 to 4 GB of RAM will suffice. For specific uses like music or editing, 16 GB is a standard. As for Gamers, 8 GB is generally sufficient.
  • Expansion ports: An essential aspect of your choice is where your expansion cards will be connected. 
  • S-ATA connectors: These connectors are used by hard disks (HDD), optical drives, and fast SSDs, among others. Each of them must have a SATA connector.

What is the size of the best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K do you need?

The size of the best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K will determine by the size of the gaming PC, but especially in the connectivity, you carry. Although there are many possible motherboard sizes, the most common are given below:

  • ATX: It comes in the most standardized size that is 12 inches long by 9,625 wide. They have all the connectivity that you are going to need in a normal way.
  • Mini-ITX: they are the smallest in size, designed for mini PCs and SFF format PCs. Typically, the Mini-ITX has only one PCIe socket and two RAM sockets to save space.
  • Micro-ATX: They are wide as the ATX but comes in 2.4 inches shorter. They generally have the same features but fewer PCI-Express and M.2 sockets.

Editor’s choice:

As always, intel remains the best in terms of budget. However, I prefer Asus Tuf gaming z590-plus wifi because of eco-friendly and consider as the best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K in 2021.

 Adapted to gaming, the z590-plus remains at the top of the entry-level with a not disgusting performance more than affordable price and gives full support.

Asus Tuf gaming z590-plus wifi

Asus Tuf gaming z590 is the best Motherboard for core i5-11600K, as it is considered a Motherboard leader. If you’re looking for a good example of Motherboard that delivers quality, then choose the Asus Tuf gaming X570-Plus. However, it comes with different capabilities, a maximum RAM capacity of 128 GB, PCI Express 4.0, overclocking up to 4400 MHz, and a good package of connectors that include USB Type-C, DisplayPort, USB 3.2 gen 1 and 2 ports, HDMI 1.4B and the full set of audio jacks, etc.

TUF Gaming Z590-Plus WiFi is positioned as a gaming solution, not overclocking. The power subsystem looks very solid. Such components can only be found on high-end flagship models.

Perhaps this is the way it should be since the processors do not get colder, and the TDP has not changed for the new CPUs and is also 125 W for the top models. Capsule capacitors, solid-state, wired nearby.

 Also, where this X570 motherboard shines, it concerns the temperatures of the VRMs, which are excellent for this price range.  The ASUS TUF Gaming Z590-Plus WiFi model is not as luxurious as the ROG Strix Z590-E Gaming WiFi. Still, the main functions are presented in the same volume, and even the power subsystem is similar, albeit a little simpler. The main point of its acquisition is that there is support for the same modern interfaces, new processors, the latest generation wireless network, and other newfangled goodies, but at a more attractive price.

Characteristics to consider when purchasing best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K

Since the Motherboard for Core i5-11600K seems the richest hardware component, it is a bit tricky to choose the best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K. So far in the above portion, we have defined the ones that we consider most important, which you should look at according to your needs when choosing the best Motherboard for you. 

There are some different characteristics of Motherboard that is listed below:

  • Diagnostic panel: the small speaker connecting to the Motherboard comes in handy to tell us if there are any errors through the famous beeps on the Motherboard. If the board has a diagnostic panel that will tell us with numbers the error that we should look for in the manual, everything will be much easier and faster. 
  • The power button and reset on the board: always come in handy, especially if you often change hardware or like to do tests.  
  • Wi-Fi connectivity: if you do not have a physical network connection near the computer, it is always good that the board has its WiFi module so that you don’t depend on external one.
  • Dual Ethernet ports: a single Gigabit Ethernet port will give us enough bandwidth to do anything we need, but if you plan to use the PC as a home server or video streaming, a dual RG-45 Gigabit port will always be helpful.

Format of the Selected Motherboard:

To suit different needs and case sizes, the best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K has a standardized size format that suits different case sizes or requirements, varying from large to maximum possibilities that accommodate many elements. Here is the standards form of Motherboard from the largest to the smallest:

  • ATX: it is the most popular format for the general public. Also, it is considered as the default choice, which satisfies many people because of its high functionality ratio and good size. 
  • E-ATX: it is made for demanding users because of the largest motherboard formats. For instance, the E-ATX pushes the multi-GPU to its maximum, makes it possible to have two CPUs, and offers different types of possible slots. 
  • Mini-ITX: suitable for smaller towers because of the small format democratized to date and design to cover little possible space that is more easily transported. The only problem is it provides a minimum of the union at its offer level, just like microATX. 
  • MicroATX: Suitable for small towers because it is a scaled-down form factor version of the ATX but sacrifices a few things, typically PCI Express ports.

Comparison of the best motherboards for playing video games

Low-end motherboards:

  • Gigabyte X570 UD – Intel – Best budget performance
  • ASUS TUF H370-Pro Gaming Wi-Fi – Intel- Best budget for a non-overclocked processor

Mid-range motherboards:

  • ATX X229 – Gigabyte X299x Designare 10G – Best AMD motherboard for multi-core users
  • Mini-ITX Z390 – ASRock Z390 Phantom Gaming ITX – low expensive, powerful and compact

FAQ:

What is a motherboard VRM?

Voltage Regulator Module (VRM) represents a power supply system based on capacitors on a motherboard; their role is to regulate the electrical voltage of CPUs and GPUs. They weigh a lot in the price balance of motherboards because the more there are and the more quality VRMs, the more stable and well managed the system will be in terms of temperature. The importance of VRMs is particularly important in overclocking.

Which processor is compatible with my Motherboard?

You will find this information on the website of your card manufacturer in the “Support” section.

How to properly identify your needs?

The Motherboard is by far the unique part of your computer, the one that opens the most possibilities of customization and which allows a wide range of functionalities.

As such, the choice is all the more delicate as there are motherboards for everything, for everyone, and on fairly wide price ranges. From gaming and streaming to heavy applications, including office automation or mini PCs for gaming. 

How many expansion slots?

The PCI Express expansion bus is the current standard that allows many peripherals to be added to our motherboards: graphics cards, network, sound, acquisition cards, RAID controller, and so on.

Four types of PCIe slots are distinguished according to their number of lanes (1x; 4x; 8x; 16x), which also influences the size of the connector and its performance.

Do I need to update the BIOS?

Yes. Updating your device’s BIOS may allow you to use a recent processor to improve hardware support or increase machine stability.

Final words:

The best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K is used to connect all the components, to make them work between them (and to operate the PC incidentally), whether it is the processor (CPU), the graphics card (GPU), the random access memory (RAM), storage media (HDD / SSD), power supply, or even the PC case.Perhaps, the Motherboard is the technical component of the PC and plays an essential role. Indeed, we can’t neglect the fact that it’s hard to find the right Motherboard for Core i5-11600K that comes into your budget. Our buying guide of the best Motherboard for Core i5-11600K is therefore here to help and guide you.

item.title: Top 5 Intel 11th Gen Motherboards of 2021 [Best i9-11900k Motherboard]
item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: When it comes to building a fast PC, either for gaming, work or studying, we all need a system that functions fast. One that does not cause any lag or cause any delay in the workflow. That’s an ideal system.  That is a vital requirement, especially in today’s environment where people work from home and ... item.content:encoded:
When it comes to building a fast PC, either for gaming, work or studying, we all need a system that functions fast. One that does not cause any lag or cause any delay in the workflow. That’s an ideal system. 

That is a vital requirement, especially in today’s environment where people work from home and attend school online. You cannot have a laptop that is slow and inefficient. In order to keep up with your work and studies, you need a PC with maximum efficiency. 

One of the major components of a good PC is a very efficient motherboard. With the number of options available in the market today, it can be challenging to choose a good motherboard for your system.

That’s why we’re here to help. We’ve created a list of the top 5 best Intel 11th Gen Motherboard, complete with their details, specifications, pros, and cons.

Best Intel 11th Gen Motherboards

Preview Product Rating Price
ROG Strix Z590-E Gaming WiFi 6E LGA 1200(Intel® 11th/10th Gen)... 838 Reviews $223.31 Buy now

ROG Strix Z590-E Motherboard

Attention gamers! If you’re looking for a better-performing motherboard to fire up your system, this is what you’ll need. 

The ROG Strix Z590-E is a motherboard specially designed for gamers. It is priced at $374 and comes with a set of instructions, an extra fan (40mm), a set of screws and plastic cords to help you fix everything in place, and so much more!

Let’s look at their details and specifications in-depth, shall we?

It is a motherboard that has been specially designed for gamers and gaming purposes alone. Some of their standout features include the following.

First Class AI features

This motherboard has a gaming processor that uses AI Technology for the purpose of noise cancelation, system cooling, and system over-clocking and networking.

That helps you to simplify the process of setup and also provides you with a better experience.

Extensive USB slot options

It has a number of USB slots, including 4 slots with heat-dissipating sinks for M2 and USB slots for the 3.2 gen and SATA of type–C. 

Compatibility

This motherboard is compatible with both of Intel’s 11th and 10th generation processors. It is also compatible with the latest WiFi type – the 6E.

Suitable Power Options

They come with power points of 14+2 that come along with a ProCool II power adapter. It also comes with reliable capacitors made of superior and durable alloy metal to help run these processors. 

Suitable Designs To Handle Heat

A high-performing motherboard tends to release a lot of heat while functioning. Hence this has been designed in such a way that it can remove the heat safely without overworking itself.

It has a heat-dissipating sink made of aluminum, a heat pipe, 4 built-in sinks to release heat, and other similar outlets.

Efficient Networking Properties

Gamers usually play in teams that require a lot of communicating. That is why this motherboard is designed to be compatible with the latest WiFi. (WiFi 6E or 802.11ax).

Along with the LANGuard of ASUS, it is also designed to support Ethernet of 2.5GB.

High Connectivity For The Best Gaming Experience

Ask any gamer what the most important part of the experience is, and they’ll tell you it’s the graphics. Visuals play a huge role and contribute a lot to the overall experience. 

That is why this motherboard is designed to support the latest version of HDMI (Version 2.0). It also has a port for display and visuals, 4 slots with heat-dissipating sinks for M2, and USB slots for the 3.2 gen and SATA of type–C. 

Design That Is User Friendly

Most of these setups are fairly easy to handle if you have basic knowledge of how laptops and PCs function. 

They come with one FlexKey, one FlashBack (by BIOS), and other programs that help you set up this system easier. 

Option Of Personalization

This particular motherboard allows the user to make changes to suit their personality. RGB changes can be made in the lighting and headers.  

Complete Audio

The second most important aspect to an enjoyable gaming experience is the audio. Audio helps the experience more realistic, which makes it more enjoyable. 

This motherboard includes the amplifier from Savitech (SV3H712) along with DTS’s Sound Unbound program with Sonic Studio III.

Overall Powerful Software

This motherboard also comes with professional software like the dashboard from UEI BIOS, combined with MemTest86.

MSI Z590 PRO Motherboard

This motherboard from MSI has definitely got to be one of the more affordable motherboards in the market today. For a price of $211 it has quite a lot of good features to it.

However, it does have a few negatives to it. So, the question here is, do the pros outweigh the cons? It surely does!

Let’s take a quick look at their top features.

Compatible Motherboard

This motherboard is specially designed to work with Intel’s 11 Generation Core Processor. But if you can’t afford it at the moment, don’t worry! The MSI motherboard is suitable for use with Intel’s 10 Generation Core Processor as well.

Accommodates A Variety Of USB Ports 

This motherboard allows you to plug in as many devices as you want, thanks to the plentiful number of options that MSI has provided. 

It has 1 type–C port, 1 type–C internal connector, and 1 type-A port, all on the motherboard’s back panel. It also has 2 type-A ports that you can find on the back panel, and 4 other ports can be found on the motherboard itself.

It has a 2.0 version of the type–A port located on the back panel, and 4 USB ports (version 2.0) can be used through internal USBs.

Expansive Memory And Storage Options

They can really take in a lot of materials because of the 4 DDR4 memory slots. In total, they can support up to 128GB of data. When used with Intel’s 11th Gen processor, they can easily run about 5333 MHz and maybe even more!

Captivating Visual And Sound Effects

In order to give you a complete experience in terms of audio and visuals, this motherboard offers you the following software-

To provide you with high-quality visuals with the highest resolution of up to 4K 60Hz, the MSI motherboard has preinstalled HDMI software (version 2.0) along with an HDR port. It also has a DisplayPort that also offers you the same resolution.

A Realtek software (Model ALC897 Codec with 7.1-Channel High Definition Audio) has also been preinstalled in the motherboard to give you a full surround sound experience.

It will almost feel like you’re living the PC experience with these visual and audio software in real-time!

Network And Data Connectivity

It also provides you the feature of connecting through Bluetooth and WiFi. The wireless unit is already installed in the motherboard, so there’s no need for you to purchase and manually install it individually.

It is also compatible with Bluetooth, and FIPS and FISMA have approved it.

ASUS Prime H510M-E Motherboard

In general, the Prime series of Asus is designed to handle a student’s workload or someone who is working from home. It was not originally created for the purpose of gaming, but surprisingly, the motherboard performs well under that situation as well!

It is also very affordable. But is it just as good as the expensive ones? Let’s find out.

Powered By The Latest

This motherboard can be powered by Intel’s latest 11th Gen processor. Although it is designed to fit the latest model, it can also work well with Intel’s 10th Gen processor.

It also has the H510 chipset for better performance.

Storage And Memory Functions

For storing data and information, this motherboard uses the 2DDR4 program (which is dual channel). Hence, it can store data up to 64GB. 

It is also compatible with Intel’s XMP (stands for Extreme Memory profile). That adds to the overall capacity and increases the total storage space.

Outstanding Graphics And Audio Quality

In terms of graphics and visuals, this motherboard has 1 DisplayPort (Version 1.4), 1 D-Sub with HDMI features.

If you are using the motherboard with Intel’s 11th Gen processor, your HDMI 2.0 will support a maximum resolution of 4K at 30Hz. 

Keep in mind that the exact specifications for graphics will differ based on the types of CPU.

Now, let’s look at audio.

This motherboard is preinstalled RealTek Surround Sound High Definition (Version 7.1) for audio. This software can detect when an audio jack has been plugged or unplugged from the system. 

It can also stream multiple audios simultaneously and hold up to 192kHz or 24-Bit playback. 

It also comes with features of audio shielding and uses quality Japanese capacitors just for audio. It also comes with audio PCB layers. 

With these combined features, you can experience fantastic visuals with full surround sound. 

Cooling System

When you work on a PC or a laptop, it tends to heat up. That is normal as long as the heat finds a way out. That is why cooling fans are installed inside. 

This processor has 1 CPU Fan Header with 4 pins and 2 Chassis Fan Headers with 4 pins. It’ll help keep the system cool even as you work overtime. 

Power Functions

It has 1 central power connector with 24-pin and 1 power connector with 8-pin and 12V. 

Storage And USB Features

They consist of 1 M.2 slot (Key M) and 4 SATA 6Gb/s ports to help with internal storage. When it comes to USB, they have 1 USB (Version 3.2 Gen) with 1 header that carries another extra 2 USB (Version 3.2 Gen 1) ports. 

Aside from this, they also have 2 USB (Version 2.0) headers that carry another 4 USB (Version 2.0) ports.

It can give any PC/Laptop an ample amount of space for storing their data. 

Other than the usual features that come with almost all motherboards, Asus adds extra features that further improve the board. 

Safety And Protection

  • Preinstalled DIGI and VRM software
  • Preinstalled LANGuard

ROG Maximus XIII Hero 

Motherboard

It is yet another motherboard made by Asus, but this model comes under the Hero series. This particular series carries all the elite features but comes at an affordable price of $500. 

It is one of the most innovative motherboards on the market and has a very sleek design. 

Let’s take a look at some of these elite features that the Hero has to offer us.

Supported Processor

This particular motherboard is designed to function with Intel’s latest 11th Gen processor. It can also support Intel’s 10th Gen processor and Pentium Gold And Celeron Processors. 

The chipset used in this motherboard is Intel Z590.

Memory Slots And Capacity

In total, they have 4 288-pin memory slots. They use the DDR4 program for storage features, and they can store a maximum of 128GB. However, the 11th Gen Intel processor might add some extra storage space to this.

Sound And Visual Features

Coming to visuals, they have 1 HDMI (Version 2.0) feature and 1 DisplayPort (Version 1.4). Keep in mind that these specifications may vary from one CPU type to another. 

For Intel 11th Gen processor, the DisplayPort can support any resolution till 5120 x 2880 at 60Hz. And for HDMI, they support any resolution till 4k at 60Hz.

Other processors will support the Displayport till 4096 x 2304 at 60Hz and HDMI till 4k at 30Hz.

Both listening to music and gaming will be a very unique experience with these software.

ASUS TUF B560M-PLUS 

Motherboard

Yet another motherboard specially designed for gamers but not necessarily limited to pro gaming purposes. 

It is a very high-speed motherboard that can also be used for people who are working from home or college students completing their assignments!

Just like the other gaming motherboard, this also has a very unique set of features. Let’s take a detailed look at them to understand better.

Processing System

These motherboards are specifically designed to be powered by Intel’s 11th Gen processor. It is the latest model and has a lot to offer for your PC!

Advanced Power Solutions

They have 8+1 different power levels, a PCB of 6 different layers, a ProCool socket, and strong capacitors for uniform and stable delivery of power at all times. These power solutions keep your PC/Laptop running for a long time without any lag so you can have an uninterrupted workflow.

Detailed Cooling System

As mentioned earlier, this motherboard has around 4 power solutions to help you stay focused on your work. However, this might start to cause some heat inside the system.

That is normal and it happens quite often. But the heat does need a way to leave the system in order to keep functioning normally. 

And that’s precisely why this motherboard also has a VRM and PCH heat-dissipating sink, a versatile M.2 heat-dissipating sink, and fan headers. They also offer the software: Fan Xpert 2+, and all these combined will keep your system sunning even when they are on for a long time. 

Immense Connectivity

Gamers usually don’t play by themselves. They play in groups, and they all stay in communication while doing so. In order for a smooth communication process, the PC needs to have software like PCIe 4.0, Realtek 2.5GB Ethernet, WiFi 6, rear USB 3.2 Gen 2, and more.

It will keep the conversation and the game going with absolute ease.

Online Gaming Softwares

This motherboard is specially built and designed for gaming purposes. And what good is a gaming motherboard without relevant software?

This model comes with these software programs – Intel WiFi 6, Realtek 2.5 GB Ethernet, TUF LANGuard, and Turbo LAN technology.

These programs help in keeping your gaming session alive and interactive. 

Enhanced Audio Features

The audio of a game is one of the features that make the gaming experience fun. This motherboard helps in reducing any background noise from the mic set and a crisp audio output. And what do you get? Undisturbed voice transmission between you and your teammates. 

Special Features

item.title: Best Motherboards for intel i5 8400 Processor
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: Intel’s Core i5-8400 processor offers six cores and six threads, which means that this processor doesn’t feature any Hyper-threading and has a clock speed of 2.80 GHz and a Max Turbo Speed of up to 4 GHz. This processor can only achieve the maximum performance when paired with both a motherboard that can supply the ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Intel’s Core i5-8400 processor offers six cores and six threads, which means that this processor doesn’t feature any Hyper-threading and has a clock speed of 2.80 GHz and a Max Turbo Speed of up to 4 GHz.

This processor can only achieve the maximum performance when paired with both a motherboard that can supply the necessary power and the correct cooling system. A motherboard needs to have the correct socket for the processor and support the processor in the BIOS.

Since the Intel Core i5-8400 is an older processor compared to today’s standard, any motherboard with the LGA 1151 socket should have a BIOS that supports the processor.

Read Also: Best GPU for Intel Core i5-8400 processor

Best Motherboards for Intel Core i5 8400

Cheapest Motherboard for i5 8400 – MSI ProSeries MicroATX Motherboard (H310)

The MSI ProSeries MicroATX motherboard is the cheapest LGA1151 motherboard on this list, but it’s not without its features, making it worth the $63.99 price tag listed on Amazon.

This MicroATX motherboard features a smaller form factor compared to the standard ATX size motherboards; this MicroATX features one full-sized PCIe slot while having two mini PCIe Slots. These slots can have various devices connected, including items like the Elgato Pro capture card or an audio card.

The full-sized PCIe slot is designed to stop GPU card sag and to bend, which can happen with the larger graphics cards.

The MSI ProSeries MicroATX Motherboard features just two RAM slots, which can support DDR4 RAM with a maximum speed of up to 2,666 MHz. This motherboard features a total of just six USB ports, with two of those ports being just USB 3.0 while the rest of the ports are USB 2.0.

This Motherboard is perfect for the Intel Core i5-8400 due to the lowered cost while still offering some fantastic features like having an M.2 and NVMe SSD slot, which can be easily accessed from the front of the Motherboard.

The MSI ProSeries MicroATX Motherboard also features an Audio boost that offers fantastic audio quality by using premium quality audio components. This higher quality audio allows the user to enjoy game-changing sound to create dynamic soundscapes.

This motherboard also has a feature called X-Boost, which auto-detects and boosts the performance from any storage, Optane, or USB device, which means storing games on an external HDD is now very viable!

Second Cheapest Motherboard for i5 8400 – MSI ProSeries MicroATX Motherboard (B365)

The Second cheapest motherboard, which can be paired with the Intel Core i5-8400 processor, is the MSI ProSeries Intel B365. This ProSeries motherboard is a bit more expensive when compared to the previous listing; this motherboard costs just $3 more, having a price of just $66.99.

This motherboard’s design is very similar to the first listing, being mostly just black in color with a metal shielding shown on the full PCIe Slot to help reduce GPU sag or GPU bending. This Motherboard also features two RAM slots allowing for up to 32 GB of 2,666 MHz RAM.

This motherboard features a bit higher specs when compared with the previous motherboard on this list, this motherboard still features just six USB ports, but now four ports are USB 3.0 while only two ports are USB 2.0. The higher amount of USB 3.0 ports are perfect due to the vast majority of devices being built.

This motherboard is a solution for new PC builders thanks to the easy layout and the overall design being easy to understand. The PCIe slot featuring a metal silver color instead of the standard black shown on the two mini PCIe slots located at the bottom of the motherboard.

The cost of the MSI ProSeries Intel B365 costs just a bit more when compared to the first listing, but the placement of the Mini PCIe slots makes installing cared in those slots tough but makes this Motherboard perfect for DIYs that are planning to utilize PCIe extenders. This motherboard currently costs $66.99 on Amazon, which is only $3 more than the previous listing.

This increase in price is due to the chipset that this motherboard uses, which is more developed and better when compared to the first motherboard.

Mid-Range Value Motherboard for i5 8400 – ASUS Prime B365M-A

The ASUS Prime B365M-A motherboard is a value motherboard that offers some features that the previous entries didn’t have. This motherboard features four RAM slots instead of just two RAM slots, which offers a maximum RAM size of 64 GB instead of just 32 GB. These new features do make the price of the mother a bit more when compared to the previous entries, this entry is priced at $79.99.

This motherboard features the same number of PCIe and mini-PCIe slots and offers a similar placement to the second entry. Since this motherboard also features metal shielding, the larger GPUs have a harder time bending when compared to motherboard without the metal shielding.

This motherboard features a total of four USB 3.0 Type-A ports while having a single USB Type-C port allowing for further expanded connectivity when compared to other motherboards.

The ASUS Prime B365M-A motherboard features five times the protection III and has hardware-level safeguards that provide both component longevity and higher reliability when compared to other motherboards.

This motherboard is the best match for the Intel Core i5-8400 processor in both performances and in price. The features that set this motherboard apart when compared to other entries are the dual M.2 / NVMe slots, which are Intel Optane Memory Ready.

These dual NVMe / M.2 Slots allow for a SATA-free PC if configured correctly. This motherboard features a total of six SATA ports if users want to expand the storage of your PC system easily.

This motherboard is currently on sale at Amazon for the cost of $79.99; this price is completely valid due to the hardware-level protection installed in this fantastic motherboard. This low-cost motherboard is a perfect choice for a budget gaming or budget VR PC.

Best High-End Motherboard for i5 8400 – ASRock Z270 Killer

The ASRock Z370 Killer Motherboard is a significant price jump, costing $249.99 on Amazon, which can support the Intel Core i5-8400 processor with ease. This higher costing motherboard offers a significantly different color scheme and design with more connectivity that many PC builders will greatly appreciate.

The ASRock Z270 Killer Motherboard features a variety of supported RAM speeds ranging from 2,133 MHz all the way up to 4,266 MHz when applying an overclock to the motherboard, although this is limited by the Intel Core i5-8400 processor, which can only support up to 2,666 MHz RAM speed. This Motherboard features a total of four RAM slots, which easily allow up to 64 GB of RAM capacity.

This motherboard is in a different form factor when compared to the previous entries; this motherboard has an ATX form factor. This ATX form factor is considerably larger when compared to the MicroATX form factor. The ATX form factor features more full-sized PCIe slots and has a total of four mini PCIe slots.

The ASRock Z270 Killer Motherboard features a total of five USB 3.0 ports and a single USB Type-C port, which offers a good range of connectivity for any enthusiast PC builder. This motherboard is the first to offer an internal WiFi Card and features two points where PC builders can screw the WiFi antennas into.

This motherboard is currently available on Amazon for a significant jump in price from the value-motherboards, this motherboard is currently listed at $249.99.

PC Enthusiast Motherboard for i5 8400 – EVGA Z390 Dark

The EVGA Z390 Dark Motherboard is even more expensive when compared to any of the previous entries in this article. This motherboard is currently available on Amazon for the price of $499.99. This higher cost is shown in the motherboard’s overall design and size; this motherboard’s form factor is the largest possible for a desktop being an E-ATX motherboard.

This larger form factor allows this motherboard to offer more features and more hardware-level safeguards when compared to the MicroATX or ATX motherboards.

This motherboard feature only two RAM slots, which can support up to 32 GB of DDR4 RAM capacity at speeds surpassing 4600 Mhz.

For connectivity, the EVGA Z390 Dark Motherboard features two USB 3.0 ports, five USB 2.0 ports, and a single USB Type-C port. This wide range of connectivity is added by dual Intel GbE LAN with Teaming Support.
This motherboard features EVGA OnBoard Audio, which features a Creative 5.1 Channel Audio and EVGA NU Audio for Headphones, which is perfect for content creators.

This higher cost of the EVGA Z390 Dark Motherboard features a higher gold content in the CPU socket; this is because gold is a perfect medium for lowering the contact resistance, which can result in better power delivery. This motherboard features an amazing 17-phase PWM, which offers the most stable power design to ensure that any PC builder is ready to upgrade from the Intel Core i5-8400 processor.

This motherboard is over the top for the Intel Core i5-8400 processor, but for anyone looking to upgrade to a better processor in the future, this motherboard is for you!

item.title: Best Motherboards for Ryzen 9 5950X
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: The Ryzen 5000 series CPUs have been announced by AMD, and PC builders are excited to get their hands on these new and improved Zen3 processors. Not only have these CPUs been optimized to play games at the maximum potential that a CPU can (currently) process, but they have also heavily increased single-core & single-thread ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
The Ryzen 5000 series CPUs have been announced by AMD, and PC builders are excited to get their hands on these new and improved Zen3 processors. Not only have these CPUs been optimized to play games at the maximum potential that a CPU can (currently) process, but they have also heavily increased single-core & single-thread performance, favoring workstation applications with 3D modelings, like CAD.

The best the Zen3 lineup has to offer, not just for gaming but also for content creation, is AMD new flagship Ryzen 9 5950X. This CPU fully utilizes the maximum potential of the new Zen3 architecture, as it has two CCXs (Core Complexes) in the CCD (Core Chiplet Die) that are both filled to the max with regards to cores and level 3 cache: Eight cores and 32 MB of L3 cache each, for a total of 16 cores, 32 threads, and a massive 64 MB L3 cache.

Of course, if you are in the market for the most powerful CPU available, then you’ll want to pair it with other equivalently powerful hardware components. Like a well-built chain, all of the links must fit together perfectly, because a weak piece of hardware will disrupt the functional harmony of the components, causing bottlenecking issues that will impact performance.

One of the most important modules to be paired with the CPU is the motherboard. The motherboard not only supplies power to the CPU, but it also plays a big role in regards to maintaining optimal CPU temperatures. Additionally, it allows for high-speed RAM utilization, storage capacity, cooling component connectivity, and audio. Because the Ryzen 9 5950X is the most powerful consumer market CPU available, the only motherboards worthy to be paired with it are the flagship X570 motherboards; the best that the AM4 chipset has to offer.

To help you choose the right one for your build, we’ve compiled a list of the most popular X570 flagship motherboards, and separated them into categories depending on their most optimal mode of use with the Ryzen 9 5950X.

Read Also: Best CPU Coolers for Ryzen 9 5950X

Best Motherboards for the AMD Ryzen 9 5950X

Preview Product Rating Price
ASRock AMD Ryzen 3000 Series CPU (Soket AM4) with X570 Chipset... 64 Reviews $598.86 Buy now
ASUS ROG X570 Crosshair VIII Formula AM4 Zen 3 Ryzen 5000 & 3rd... 347 Reviews $599.99 Buy now
MSI MEG X570 GODLIKE Motherboard (AMD AM4, PCIe 4.0, DDR4, SATA... 153 Reviews Buy now
GIGABYTE X570 AORUS Xtreme (AMD Ryzen... 148 Reviews $662.99 Buy now

Best Budget Flagship Motherboard for Ryzen 9 5950X – ASRock Phantom Gaming X

If you’ve planned your budget solely around the CPU and GPU, then chances are you are going to want your other components to be as cheap as possible, but without compromising the overall build. For that, we have ASRock’s Phantom Gaming X.

This flagship motherboard comes equipped with a 14-phase Intersil ISL69147 VRM (7 true phases: 6+6, 1+1), with 50-amp power stages, 60-amp chokes, and Nichicon FP capacitors. It has an excellent thermal solution, as all of the MOSFETs are heatsinked, and the heatsinks are linked together via a heatpipe. A PCH fan is also included.

Like all flagship motherboards, the Phantom Gaming X has four RAM slots, holding up to a total of 128 GB of DDR4 RAM with supported speeds of up to 4,666 MHz. In terms of ROM, it has eight SATA III ports and three M.2 slots – all of which include a heatsink cover.

A Wi-Fi 6 module is included with this motherboard, together with eight USB slots in the rear I/O port, as well as six four-pin fans or pumps.

The audio codec included is the standard high-end Realtek ALC1220.

For only $339.99 the ASRock Gaming X provides great VRM and thermal solutions, as well as plenty of RAM, storage, and overall connectivity.

item.title: Best Motherboards for Ryzen 7 5800X
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: AMD has recently announced their new Zen 3 processors, and the mid-range Ryzen 7 5800X is looking to be a gaming powerhouse. This CPU makes full use of a single core complex (CCX) on its core chiplet die (CCD), which contains all eight of its cores, 16 threads, and its full 32 MB of level ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
AMD has recently announced their new Zen 3 processors, and the mid-range Ryzen 7 5800X is looking to be a gaming powerhouse.

This CPU makes full use of a single core complex (CCX) on its core chiplet die (CCD), which contains all eight of its cores, 16 threads, and its full 32 MB of level 3 cache. Because of this enhanced core layout, found exclusively in the Zen 3 series CPUs – with the only exception being the Ryzen 3 3300X, which had four cores and eight threads in a single-CCX layout – the internal latencies have been reduced dramatically, to the point where these AMD’s processors can now claim Intel’s crown as the best CPU manufacturer for gaming applications as their own.

The reason why the Ryzen 7 5800X appears to be the ultimate CPU for gaming – even more so than the Ryzen 9 processors – is because current, and even next-generation, games will not use more than eight cores and 16 threads; as these are the limitations of the Xbox Series X and Playstation 5. Therefore, having more than cores than what can fit in a single CCX will become redundant, since the internal communication will have to pass between CCXs (through AMD’s infinity fabric) which will have the same internal latency found in Zen 2 processors.

 To optimize the use of the Ryzen 7 5800X, and maximize its overclocking capabilities, a motherboard of equal caliber must be paired with it. One that has solid VRM and thermal solutions that will supply the CPU with sufficient power without causing it to overheat. One that supports high-speed RAM that compliments the performance of the CPU, one that allows for an ample amount of SSD storage, a respectable audio codec, and the connectivity necessary to accommodate case fans and external USB devices.

To assist in your search for finding the perfect motherboard that pairs with the Ryzen 7 5800X, we’ve compiled a list of the best motherboards based on price, performance, and form factor.

Best Budget Motherboard for Ryzen 7 5800X – ASUS Prime X570-P

Spent too much money on the CPU and GPU, and need a respectable motherboard that won’t break the bank? We fully understand; and hence why we recommend the ASUS Prime X570-P.

With a VRM solution that features twelve 50-amp Vishay power stages (4×2, 2×2 layout), this motherboard offers power without falling short on thermals. All MOSFETs on this motherboard are heatsinked, and a fan is included on the PCH.

The Prime X570-P offers plenty of RAM storage capacity as well, with 128 GB of DDR4 memory, with speeds of up to 4,400 MHz – though 3,200 to 3,600 MHz, at CL14 and CL16 respectively, should suffice.

The ASUS Prime X570-P offers an amazing amount of connectivity for its price tag. Two PCIe 4.0 M.2 slots, six SATA III ports, four USB 3.1 Type-A, two USB 3.0 Type-A, and two USB 2.0 ports.

The only downside of this motherboard is its audio codec, as it utilizes the Realtek S1200A: Decent, but not great.

Considering the price of the ASUS Prime X570-P – which retails for $159.99, but can currently be found for $139.13 – it offers power, versatility, and value at a fraction of the cost of its competitors.

Optimizing your setup with the best hardware available for gaming, means you are going to have to spend a bit extra to get the best components money can buy. The motherboard that fits these criteria, is the ASUS ROG Crosshair VIII Hero.

The Crosshair VIII Hero offers a high-end 14+2 phase setup and 60-amp power stages – all of which are heatsinked and include top of the line embedded heatpipes to dissipate heat and keep temperatures low. Having both power and low thermals, means that you can safely, and reliably, overclock your Ryzen 7 5800X to your heart’s content.

When it comes to RAM, the Crosshair VIII Hero can accommodate up to 126 GB of DDR4 memory, with speeds reaching 4,600 MHz.

Connectivity wise, we have two PCIe 4.0 compatible M.2 slots – both of which are heatsinked – as well as eight SATA III ports. Additionally, eight USB 3.2 Gen 2 slots (one Type-C, the others Type-A) and four USB 3.2 Gen 1 ports (all Type-A) can be found on the back I/O port.

The ROG Crosshair VIII Hero features a SupremeFX S1220 codec, probably the best audio codec available in the motherboard market. It has a 120 dB SNR stereo playback and 113 dB SNR recording input; as well as Sonic Studio III, Sonic Radar III, DTS and Sound Unbound which are also included.

item.title: Best Motherboards for Ryzen 5 5600X
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: AMD’s highly anticipated Ryzen 5000 Series CPUs have finally been announced. Out of the initial batch of models, the one CPU that appears to hold the most value, in regards to performance for the price, is the Ryzen 5 5600X. Despite not being the most powerful of the processors announced, this CPU has plenty of ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
AMD’s highly anticipated Ryzen 5000 Series CPUs have finally been announced. Out of the initial batch of models, the one CPU that appears to hold the most value, in regards to performance for the price, is the Ryzen 5 5600X.

Despite not being the most powerful of the processors announced, this CPU has plenty of power to process high-end gaming applications, even at higher resolutions. The Ryzen 5 5600X comes equipped with 6 cores, including hyperthreading capabilities with 12 threads, a level 3 cache of 32 MB, PCIe 4.0 compatibility, a AM4 chipset, a TDP (Thermal Design Power) of 65 Watts, and a TSMC 7 nm FinFET fabrication process. The R5 5600X has a base clock speed of 3.7 GHz, which can be boosted to 4.6 GHz, and can support a DDR4 memory system type with RAM of up to 3,200 MHz frequencies.

Of course, all of these specifications may sound very familiar, because they are, actually, identical to the previous generation Ryzen 5 3600X processor – the only difference being that there is a trade of 0.1 GHz in base clock speed for an increase of 0.2 GHz in boost clock speed. The alterations between the Ryzen 3000 Series and Ryzen 5000 Series cannot be found in their advertised specifications, as these lie within the format of how the cores, threads, and memory are laid out. Ryzen 3000 Series CPUs had a CCX (Core Complex) that could hold four cores and 16 MB of L3 cache, whereas the Ryzen 5000 Series CCX can hold up to eight cores and 32 MB of L3 Cache. This means that all cores, and the entire L3 cache of the Ryzen 5 5600X, can fit into a single CCX – translating to far less inter-core latency and a significant boost in single-core and single-thread performance. Especially when it comes to gaming, internal latency is of utmost importance, and considering that there are very few (if any) games, currently, that make use of more than six cores and twelve threads, the Ryzen 5 5600X is a wise choice to make, especially for current generation and competitive multiplayer titles.

In order to provide enough power to make full use of the capabilities of the Ryzen 5 5600X, and its overclocking capacity, a motherboard is perhaps the most important hardware component to choose for your build. That is why we’ve compiled a list of the best motherboards in the market to pair with the AMD Ryzen 5 5600X, depending on price and form factor.

The best motherboard for those that care little about overclocking their CPU is one that will be cheap in price but still offer plenty of features, and a solid thermal solution. For its price, nothing beats the ASUS Prime X570-P.

This motherboard makes use of a 12-Phase VRM solution (4×2 + 2×2) with 50-amp Vishay power stages – all of which are heatsinked – and a fan on the PCH. It has the ability to hold up to 128 GB of DDR4 RAM, separated into four slots, with supported speeds of up to 4,400 MHz. The ASUS Prime X570-P can also accommodate two PCIe 4.0 M.2 SSDs, and six SATA III ports.

item.title: Best Motherboards for Ryzen 9 5900X
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: There hasn’t been a greater time for PC builders and PC gaming enthusiasts alike. New Nvidia and AMD GPUs on the horizon, new PCIe 4.0 SSDs, we’ve reached the peak in DDR4 memory performance, and now we also have the new and improved Ryzen 5000, Zen3, processors. It is impressive to see how AMD has ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
There hasn’t been a greater time for PC builders and PC gaming enthusiasts alike. New Nvidia and AMD GPUs on the horizon, new PCIe 4.0 SSDs, we’ve reached the peak in DDR4 memory performance, and now we also have the new and improved Ryzen 5000, Zen3, processors.

It is impressive to see how AMD has been extremely smart in managing their resources; focusing on the aspects that matter most in regards to the improvement of their Ryzen processors. Since Zen2, AMD has always held the upper hand against Intel in regards to the core and thread count of their CPUs, together with their smaller processing node, their PCIe 4.0 compatibility, and their larger L3 caches. This generation around, seeing that their Ryzen 3000 series still lead Intel in this regard, instead of increasing their core and thread count, they instead opted for increasing their clock speeds and, more importantly, reducing their internal latencies. Using the same technology found in the Ryzen 3 3300X, which had a unified CCX (Core Complex) that contained all of its cores and L3 cache within the same CCD (chiplet die) – which resulted in far less core to core latency and allowed this inexpensive 4-core processor to reach incredibly high gaming performance – the Ryzen 5000 Series CPUs now feature double the amount of cores and threads within the same CCX. With 8 cores feeding off one 32 MB L3 cache, latency is reduced immensely, meaning much better gaming performance without increasing either the cost of manufacturing, or the power consumption.

If you’re looking to build a brand-new gaming desktop, then the most important component to pair with the CPU is the motherboard. The motherboard is what feeds the processor the proper amount of power in order to make full use of its overclocking capabilities, as well as keep its temperature low enough so that it doesn’t overheat and impact its lifespan. It is also what will allow you to make use of the PCIe 4.0 capabilities of the AM4 chipset, its RAM compatibility, and much more.

To help you find a suitable motherboard to pair with your Ryzen 9 5900X purchase, we’ve compiled a list of the best motherboards, depending on price, function, and form factor.

So, which are these best motherboards for Ryzen 5000 Series CPUs? Let’s find out.

Read Also: Best CPU Coolers for Ryzen 9 5900X

item.content:encoded:
The Ryzen 5 1600x and 1600 are mid-range processors introduced by AMD in early 2017. With the 6 cores and 12 threads featured by these processors, you will surely get an increase in performance on both gaming and productivity workload, which makes it a great value for most consumers. If you already have one of these processors, and planning to get a motherboard to partner with it, you need to make sure that the motherboard you choose contains all the capabilities and features needed, so you will get the best out of your Ryzen 5 1600 or 1600x.

We recommend you to go with either B450 or B350 motherboards for the Ryzen 5 1600/1600x. These types of motherboards will provide the decent performance you need, and it’s kinda overkilled if you get an X470 chipset or higher. The best thing about these types of motherboards is that there are a lot of good deals on the market, you just need to make sure that the motherboard you choose will provide the exact performance you need. However, all motherboards that are included in this guide will work perfectly fine with your Ryzen 5 1600x and 1600.

You might also like to check out the list of the best motherboard for Ryzen 5 2600.

item.content:encoded:
The Ryzen 5 3600X represents a strong one-size-fits-all answer for gamers. It’s undoubtedly a convincing upgrade over previous generation chips, capable of providing great performance in both gaming and an all-day productivity workload. The Ryzen 5 3600X is the quintessential gaming CPU. It provides incredible performance execution at a value that bodes well. In case you’re attempting to build a ground-breaking gaming framework where each dollar counts, the Ryzen 5 3600X is directly in the sweet spot. However, you should also consider getting a motherboard that can handle the power it’s throwing. The motherboard will become your way in order to maximize the full potential of your CPU.

In this guide, we will show the best motherboards that you can partner with your Ryzen 5 3600x. You don’t have to stress over getting incompatible, poor thermal cooling performance, and lack of features since all motherboards that are included in this guide contain all the capabilities and features needed to max out the full potential of your Ryzen 5 3600x.

We also have a list of the recommended motherboards for Ryzen 5 2600 if you want to check it out.

Best Value Motherboard For Ryzen 5 3600x – MSI B450M Mortar MAX

We want to introduce to you the MSI B450M Mortar MAX motherboard. It is a MicroATX motherboard design for providing great performance.

The MSI B450M Mortar MAX motherboard supports 3rd generation processors, including APUs that are still running on a Vega graphics card. It has 4 DIMM slots with a maximum capacity of 128GB and supports clock speed up to 4133Mhz when overclocked, which helps you to achieve fast performance in gaming and productivity workload. Likewise, it accompanies a dual M.2 slot, including Turbo M.2 utilizing Gen3 x4 that can process data transfer speed up to 32 GB/s.

Also, the best thing about this motherboard is that it comes with a much better thermal cooling performance to maintain the low CPU temperature, which is ideal for the Ryzen 5 3600x since the CPU is packed with multiple cores. Along with a fully controllable fan header that allows you to manage the speed and temperature for all other connected fans to maintain a silent but cool system.

The MSI B450M Mortar MAX is an amazing motherboard, and we highly recommend this to partner with your Ryzen 5 3600x. If you want to achieve decent overclocking, this motherboard is the best choice for you. We have seen a lot of positive reviews regarding the performance of this motherboard. We don’t recommend you to buy super cheap motherboards since the vast majority of them have poor thermal cooling performance and lack of ability in overclocking. The MSI B450M Mortar MAX will work perfectly fine with your Ryzen 5 3600x CPU.

There is also a B450 Tomahawk, an option if you prefer an ATX form factor. It delivers almost the same performance in terms of VRMs and overclocking. The only difference is that the B450 Tomahawk supports only a single M.2 and has a maximum memory capacity of 64GB. However, if you are okay with that, the B450 Tomahawk is a fine choice for you, you just need to make sure to update the BIOS.

Of course, we have an option for people who are building a compact PC. Also, this motherboard doesn’t support multi GPU setup since it only has a single full-length PCIe slot. We highly advise you to check first your existing components before buying this motherboard to make sure that this will support your existing build.

Overall, this MSI B450I Gaming Plus AC ITX motherboard will still deliver great performance on your build. If you are planning to build a compact PC and want to minimize the space, this motherboard is a great choice for you. This board will work perfectly fine with your Ryzen 5 3600x CPU.

It also comes with the latest gen4 PCI-E and triple M.2, which will help you achieve maximum data transfer speed up to 64GB/s. This motherboard is a great choice if you really want to achieve the maximum performance you need in gaming and workload activities. This motherboard comes with the latest technology, which is a good option if you are future-proofing your build.

Also, the MSI Meg X570 Unify comes with the latest WIFI 6 solution delivering speeds up to 2400Mbps and an onboard 2.5 Gigabit LAN with gaming LAN manager, which helps you achieve incredible gaming experience in online gaming.

item.title: Best B450 Motherboards for Ryzen 5 2600: From Budget to High-end Option
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: The release of Ryzen 5000 series processors is indeed a hype for PC builders and gamers alike. Powered by the newest AMD architecture (Zen 3), AMD now managed to take the crown from the long domination of Intel as the best provider of gaming desktop processors. Another thing is that AMD still makes use of ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
The release of Ryzen 5000 series processors is indeed a hype for PC builders and gamers alike. Powered by the newest AMD architecture (Zen 3), AMD now managed to take the crown from the long domination of Intel as the best provider of gaming desktop processors. Another thing is that AMD still makes use of the current chipset and socket type, which is a great upgrade opportunity for previous-gen CPU users, allowing them to upgrade without a need of a new motherboard. However, the global shortage of semiconductor products makes it hard for PC builders to build their next PC powered by the new components released last year. Though the only option is to buy above MSRP.

Lucky for us that Intel and AMD have plenty of CPUs to offer, especially for mid-end desktop rigs. One of the best processors around today for mid-range builds is the Ryzen 5 2600, offering a higher core count and decent gaming-performance at an incredible price. A cost-effective solution for gamers and PC builders. The Ryzen 5 2600 is currently sitting for around 199$. A detailed review from Hardware Unboxed shows that the Ryzen 5 2600 is only 7% slower than the X version but 13% cheaper, which makes it quite a better choice compared to it when it comes to the price-to-performance ratio. Though the disappointing aspect – is the downgrade of the stock cooler, from Wraith Spire Cooler that is present with the X version to the wraith stealth. So, if you wish to overclock your Ryzen 5 2600, a good third-party cooler is a must. Here is the article for the best aftermarket cooler for the Ryzen 5 2600 if you want to check it out.

To get the most out of your Ryzen 5 2600, you might want to pair it with a good motherboard with plenty of connectivity to offer and decent quality VRMs for overclocking. B450 Chipset is the one we recommend for the Ryzen 5 2600, it is the successor of B350, and it provides better performance overall. Though there is an X470 motherboard, it might be overkill for the Ryzen 5 2600, the B450 chipset will work just fine. We’ve listed the best B450 motherboards that you can pair with the Ryzen 5 2600, whether for a budget option or for intensive overclocking.

Best B450 Motherboards to pair with the Ryzen 5 2600:

Preview Product Rating Price
ASUS Prime B450M-A II AMD AM4 (Ryzen 5000, 3rd/2nd/1st Gen Ryzen... 4,742 Reviews $79.99 Buy now

ASRock Mini-ITX Motherboard (B450 Gaming-ITX/AC) 910 Reviews $146.49 Buy now

Best Budget Motherboard for Ryzen 5 2600 – ASUS Prime B450M-A II

Sitting for only 79$, the ASUS Prime B450M-A II is the best budget motherboard we’ve found available on the market. This mATX motherboard packs a 6 power phase (4+2) VRM solution with heatsink, providing a decent power delivery to slightly overclock the Ryzen 5 2600.

When it comes to connectivity, it supports up to 128GB of DDR4 memory with a max frequency of 4400MHz, a single PCIe x16, 1x M.2 (SATA & PCIe 3.0 x 4 mode), 6x SATA 6Gb/s ports, and 6x USB ports on the rear I/O.

Note: The M.2 slot shares bandwidth with the SATA6G_5/6 ports, so the SATA6G_5/6 ports cannot be used when an M.2 device is installed.

Also, this motherboard features a BIOS flashback, so you can update the BIOS even without a CPU or DRAM installed and will ready to support the new Ryzen 5000 series processors, preferably the mid-range Ryzen 5 5600X CPU. However, we’ve listed the best motherboards for the Ryzen 5 5600X if you want to check it out.

If you are looking for a budget B450 motherboard to pair with the Ryzen 5 2600, the ASUS Prime B450M-A II is quite hard to beat for its price point with the features and connectivity it offers.

4,742 Reviews

Best Value Motherboard for Ryzen 5 2600 – MSI B450 Tomahawk Max II

One of the most recommended motherboards from PC enthusiasts is the MSI B450 Tomahawk Max II. A very capable motherboard that doesn’t break the bank. Having a “II” in its model name, this B450 Tomahawk Max II is the 3rd and newest version of the original B450 Tomahawk that was released in 2018 alongside Zen+ architecture.

Overclocking the Ryzen 5 2600 on this motherboard is more than capable. This board does come with a solid VRM solution, a 6 phase (4+2) power delivery around the Richtek RT8894A PWM controller. Tested by many enthusiasts, the MSI B450 Tomahawk Max II can even handle a highly OC Ryzen 7 2700X, so overclocking the Ryzen 5 2600 on this motherboard would be a piece of cake. And that’s the reason why this board ranks as one of the best B450 motherboards when it comes to VRM quality and overclocking capabilities.

Compared to the previous versions of this motherboard, the MSI B450 Tomahawk Max II offers a slightly better feature set – a much better audio codec and an improved memory topology to be able to support a much higher RAM frequency for up to 4133MHz. When it comes to connectivity, it is almost identical to the previous version, having 2x PCIe Gen 3 x16 slots (Support for CrossFireX), 1x M.2 slot, 6 SATA 6GB/s ports (5,6 will be disabled once M.2 is used), and a 6 USB ports on the rear panel including a single USB Type-C.

The aggressive design plus the features this motherboard has are the reasons why it is our top recommendation for the best value B450 motherboards for the Ryzen 5 2600.

Best Feature Rich Motherboard for Ryzen 5 2600 – MSI B450 Gaming PRO Carbon MAX WiFi

If you are looking for a motherboard that offers premium features and impressive VRM. You cannot go wrong with the MSI B450 Gaming PRO Carbon MAX WiFi.

It is one of the highest-end B450 motherboards available on the market right now. Thanks to the enhanced circuit design (8+2 Power phase) and improved VRM heatsink, this motherboard is suitable for PC enthusiasts who will perform extensive overclocking. You can also take advantage of the premium features available on this motherboard, such as a better audio codec, built-in WIFI & Bluetooth, dual M.2 slots, an M.2 Heatsink, and a dedicated gaming design with fantastic RGB lightings.

Sitting for only 159$ (can be lower sometimes), this motherboard is a better choice, for the features and performance it offers. Overall, the MSI B450 Gaming PRO Carbon MAX WiFi is the highest-end motherboard that we recommend to pair with the Ryzen 5 2600 processor.

Best Mini ITX Motherboard for Ryzen 5 2500 – ASRock Fatal1ty B450I Gaming Plus AC

Of course, we always have an option for users who want to build a compact PC. Our best recommendation for the mini ITX motherboard goes to the ASRock Fatal1ty B450I Gaming Plus AC.

Though we all know that most small motherboards often lack the other important features that are present with ATX boards, the ASRock Fatal1ty B450I Gaming Plus AC takes the opposite approach. It offers some of the features that the other ATX motherboard has, such as excellent overclocking, a USB Type-C, and Bios Flashback.

The ASRock Fatal1ty B450I Gaming Plus AC is one of the cheapest mini ITX motherboards right now. Sitting for only 129$ (price can be high or low sometimes), you will get an integrated Bluetooth and a WIFI powered by the Intel 802.11ac WiFi Module, 2x DIMM slots that can support up to 64GB 3466Mhz of DDR4 memory, 4x SATA ports, an Ultra M.2 slot, and a 6x USB ports on the rear that include a USB Type-C.

For compact PC builders, this mini ITX motherboard is a pretty solid option for the price and feature set it offers.
